Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on fake news articles and rumors circulating on the internet. The Eritrean government officials have debunked the claim and stated that it is not true.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there is a shortage of men in Eritrea, which is not supported by factual evidence. The claim is based on a false premise.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Eritrean government has denied the existence of any law mandating men to take multiple wives. The government officials have stated that the claim is false.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that the Eritrean government has made it mandatory for men to take at least two wives. This is not supported by any credible evidence and is an exaggeration of the situation.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times as it is based on fake news articles and rumors. It does not provide accurate information and is not supported by factual evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
